moves.1. e4 e5 2. d4 exd4 3. Qxd4 Nc6 4. Qd1 N: 9. a3?  g3 is the only way to stop a King-side attack.  Watch this...
I've done this thousands of times.
moves.13. Kf1: If I can get my Bishop to h3, white could be in a world of hurt...
moves.13... Ne5 14. Qd4: Very clever move for white...threatening checkmate on g7...
moves.14... d6 15. f4: When you find yourself in a difficult position, look for something to attack!
moves.16. Qxd6 b6: I could save the Knight but I'm eager  to continue my attack so I exchange my knight for a powerful  tempo.
moves.17. fxe5 Bh3+ 18. Ke1: ??  18. Kf2, Qg2+   19. Ke3  would have been much better for white.
White's pinned queen is almost useless and my king is safe though thin on cover.
